byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.

abstract: Syria experiences significant lull in fighting on first day of fragile cease-fire negotiated by United States and Russia; scattered pockets of violence fail to upset truce, which excludes Nusra Front and Islamic State fighters.

headline.print_headline: Violence in Syria Abates on Day 1 of Cease-Fire
headline.main: Violence in Syria Abates on Day 1 of Cease-Fire

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Fighting decreased significantly in the country following a truce brokered by the United States and Russia, though there were reports of scattered violations.
lead_paragraph: Fighting decreased significantly in the country following a truce brokered by the United States and Russia, though there were reports of scattered violations.
